New Records: Virat Kohli finished with 765 runs from 11 matches, the third pair to finish 1-2 on batting charts in ODI World Cup history
Key Match Events: Travis Head hit 137 as Australia chased down 241 in the final against India
Rohit Sharma hit 47, Shubman Gill, Shreyas Iyer and Suryakumar Yadav failed to have any kind of impact
KL Rahul hit only one four in a 107-ball 66
Virat Kohli scored 54, took his foot off the accelerator in a strange partnership with Rahul
Jasprit Bumrah struck twice off successive overs to remove Mitchell Marsh and Steve Smith
Marnus Labuschagne was the perfect man to play second fiddle to an aggressive Travis Head
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage
India had won 10 successive matches before losing the 2023 World Cup final
Australia had won their first World Cup in 1987 and then followed it up with three successive titles in 1999, 2003 and 2007
Post-Match Reflections: India would be disappointed with their performance in the final but they should be proud of what they achieved in the run-up to the title clash
Virat Kohli finished with 765 runs from 11 matches while Rohit Sharma was second with 597 runs
Mohammed Shami, who did not play the first few matches against Australia, Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh, finished as the leading wicket-taker in the 2023 World Cup
Jasprit Bumrah also finished with 20 wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was slow but it was by no means a bad cricket surface
India's efforts on Sunday brought back memories of a similar exhibition against England in the semifinal of the T20 World Cup in 2022
Sunil Gavaskar questioned the need for Rohit Sharma to play a rash shot at a time when he should have consolidated on a good start
